pullrequest.title: Fix missing shadows and normal maps when using ogre 1.9

content.raw:
Looking into the differences for this file and the ogre-1.8, my system shows:

```
#!diff
jrivero@nium rtshaderlib $ diff -u FFPLib_Common.glsl ../rtshaderlib150/FFPLib_Common.glsl 
--- FFPLib_Common.glsl	2014-02-21 22:34:30.184056081 +0100
+++ ../rtshaderlib150/FFPLib_Common.glsl	2014-12-18 02:03:47.356275120 +0100
@@ -1,11 +1,10 @@
-#version 120
 /*
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 This source file is part of OGRE
 (Object-oriented Graphics Rendering Engine)
 For the latest info, see http://www.ogre3d.org
 
-Copyright (c) 2000-2012 Torus Knot Software Ltd
+Copyright (c) 2000-2013 Torus Knot Software Ltd
 Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
 of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
 in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
@@ -224,6 +223,12 @@
 }
 
 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+void FFP_Lerp(in vec3 vIn0, in vec3 vIn1, in vec4 T, out vec3 vOut)
+{
+	vOut = mix(vIn0, vIn1, T.xyz);
+}
+
+//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 void FFP_DotProduct(in float vIn0, in float vIn1, out float vOut)
 {
 	vOut = dot(vIn0, vIn1);
```

Is the 1.9 compatible with the 1.8? Or our only way to go is to have both inside our code?
